Entries.give_flowersA: Oh, my...$h#$b#These are for me then, skipper?$4#$b#I suppose a little love won't be so bad.
Entries.give_flowersB: Why, skipper...$h#$b#I had no idea! Yes! Of course!$4#$b#The sea will just have to get used to sharing.$h
Entries.give_pendant: Hmm... if it's you, skipper, then...$h#$b#Yes. I'll marry you.$4#$b#I'll go talk to ol' Lewis and say my goodbyes to my boat.$h
Entries.stardrop_gift: Skipper, got something to say.$4#$b#I wanted to give you this stardrop to show my love.$h#$b#Thank you. For everything.$h
Entries.rejectNPCA: I took my rod out of that pond ages ago... The sea is my lover.$h
Entries.rejectNPCB: Nothing can take my heart from the sea.#$b#I am hers forever.$h
Entries.reject_two_heartA: Ah, laddie. There are plenty of other fish in the sea ^Ah lassie. There are plenty of other fish in the sea.
Entries.reject_two_heartB: Why don't you ask that nice Elliot fella over in the cabin yonder, skipper?$h
Entries.reject_four_heartA: A nice thought. But I'd never be home. The sea is a cruel mistress like that.$h
Entries.reject_four_heartB: I'm sure you have better options than some sea-dog.
Entries.engageA: I don't feel comfortable with you doing this.$2
Entries.engageB: You're going to break someone's heart like that.$2
Entries.marriedA: Aren't you being a little greedy?$2
Entries.refusal_knownA: Managed to track down that old mariner, did you? Or is that just a ghost tale?$h
Entries.refusal_knownB: I think I saw a mermaid once. They do exist, you know?
Entries.refusal_botherA: I don't know what game you're playing skipper, but this needs to stop.$5
Entries.refusal_botherB: I don't want to be land-locked away from my truest love.$5
Entries.refusal_no_heartsA: That's a valuable item.  Don't sell it.
Entries.refusal_no_heartsB: Ahhh a Mermaid's Pendant.  Hold on to that for someone you truly love.$h
